Title: Fellow, Global Health Policy Center, CSIS
Short Bio: Anna Carroll is a fellow for global health security with the CSIS Global Health Policy Center. Before joining CSIS, Anna contributed to global advocacy efforts for polio eradication at the United Nations Foundation and spent several years at NASTAD, partnering with foreign governments to strengthen national HIV case surveillance systems.
Long Bio: Anna Carroll is a fellow for global health security with the CSIS Global Health Policy Center. Before joining CSIS, Anna contributed to global advocacy efforts for polio eradication at the United Nations Foundation. Previously, Anna spent several years at NASTAD, partnering with foreign governments to strengthen national HIV case surveillance systems in countries in Africa, the Caribbean, and South and Central America. She received a Master of Science in Foreign Service Degree with distinction from Georgetown University and a Bachelor of Arts Degree in French from Cornell University.

Title: Program Coordinator with the Global Health Policy Center at the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS)
Short Bio: Amith Mandavilli is a program coordinator with the Global Health Policy Center at the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS). Before joining CSIS, Amith interned with the Political Affairs Section of the U.S. Mission to the United Nations. There, he worked alongside U.S. diplomats who staffed the U.S. ambassador to the United Nations at the UN Security Council. Amith received degrees in political science and biological sciences from North Carolina State University.

Before joining CSIS, Amith interned with the Political Affairs Section of the U.S. Mission to the United Nations. Amith received degrees in political science and biological sciences from North Carolina State University.

Title: Senior Vice President and Director, Global Health Policy Center, CSIS
Short Bio: J. Stephen Morrison is senior vice president at the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) and director of its Global Health Policy Center. Dr. Morrison writes widely, has directed several high-level commissions, and is a frequent commentator on U.S. foreign policy, global health, Africa, and foreign assistance.
Long Bio: J. Stephen Morrison is senior vice president at the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) and director of its Global Health Policy Center. Dr. Morrison writes widely, has directed several high-level commissions, and is a frequent commentator on U.S. foreign policy, global health, Africa, and foreign assistance. He served in the Clinton administration, as committee staff in the House of Representatives, and taught for 12 years at the Johns Hopkins School of Advanced International Studies. He holds a Ph.D. in political science from the University of Wisconsin and is a magna cum laude graduate of Yale College.
